messages.subject: From miss Grace Emoss
messages.body:
Received: from  


A letter from Miss Grace
 
Miss Grace
 
From miss Grace Emos  20 Dec 06
 
Dearest,one
 
My name is miss Grace Emoss. I was born in Kuwait. I am married to Mr.Phillip Emoss who  worked with  Kuwait embassy in Ivory Coast for nine years before he died in the year 2003.We were married for eleven years without a child. He died after a brief illness that lasted for only four days Before his death we were both born again Christian. Since his death I decided not to remarry or get a child outside my matrimonial home which the Bible is against. When my late husband was alive he deposited the sum of $4.Million in a Bank here in Abidjan.
 
And Recently, My Doctor told me that I would not last for the next six months due to my cancer problem (cancer of the lever and stroke).
Presently this money is still in the Bank.  Having  known my condition I  am in need of a HONEST Hearted Individual Christian or Church that i will utilize this fund the way I am going to instruct herein.
 
I want somebody that will use this fund according to the desire of my late husband to help Lessprivilaged people, orphanages,widows and propagating the word of God.
I took this decision because I don't have any child that will inherit this fund, And I don't want in away where this money will be used in an unGodly way. This is why I am taking this decision to hand you over this Fund.
 
I am not afraid of death hence I know where I am going.I want you to always remember me in your daily prayers because of my up coming Cancer Surgery.
Write back to me as soon as possible because any delay in your reply will give me room in sourcing another person for this same purpose, Hoping to read from you soon. 
With God all things are possible. As soon as I receive your reply I shall give you the contact of the Bank in Abidjan. I will also issue you an authorisation letter that will prove you the present beneficiary of this fund. God bless you as you listing to the voice of reasoning,
 
 May God Bless From,
 Miss Grace Emoss.

messages.body:
Dear Miss Grace  (21 Dec 06)
 
My dear, how fortunate you were to have written to me out of all the thousands you could have chosen, for is it not written (Ezra 4:18)  "The  letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me."
 
I was sorely troubled to hear of your desperate plight; your multiple illnesses and the loss of your husband.  However dear lady, I think I am the person that is sent unto you in your hour of need, and I think it is to I that the money is meant to come. (Deuteronomy 15:8) "But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth."
 
By profession I am a merkin maker which is a small job that enables me to keep my hand in, but I would put the money to good use in my work as a ley-preacher in the "Church of the Bush".
 
We of the Church of the Bush, regard the Bush as sacred and believe it should not be removed, (Exodus 3:4) "God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses. And he said, Here am I."
 
As such we preach that the bush should be allowed to flourish, without the curse of razors, waxing or depilatory devices which are the work of the Devil.
 
Please tell me what you need from me.
 
Alex Wale

[No, I'm not turning religious, I found a 'bible quotes' web page. You put in the subject and it finds lines from the bible with those words in. Great fun for confounding Christians anywhere.]

[Scam-o-note: Scamorama is not particularly in the business of confounding Christians, but loves a good joke and hopes you will enjoy this one.]

messages.body:
My Dear Alex  (22 Dec 06)
 
May God bless you for writing,
 
I am happy that you are a christian but i want you to know that this upportunity did not reach everybody because i was looking for some one to trust in this project which i promised to accomplish for our lord Jesus,
 
all i want from you is your trust and honesty because my late husband suffered for this fund for so many years before he died and all his properties has been taking away by his enemies and none of them knows about this fund which he deposited in the bank, I decided to use this fund for the work of God because i know that i will died and i am not afraid of death because i am doing all that pleases our lord Jesus,
 
Thank you for accepts me to use you for this donation but do not betray the trust i am about to impose on you, my condition is too critical now that i can not write and the doctors daughter is helping me to send you email, i have written to the Bank where my fund was deposited and i have told them that i want the fund to be transfered to indonesia for a purpose,
 
I told the Bank that you are my late husband partner and i have given them the instruction to wire the fund to your account abroad,
 
Please i want you to contact the Bank tomorrow and introduce your self to them and try to let them know that i am the one that directed you because they all knows my condition of health,
 
This is the contacts of the Bank,
 
Coopec International Bank Abidjan Cote D'ivoire
phone:00225-01-62-38-24
fax:+225 21 56 57 09
Email info_coopecbankci_itnl@Safe-mail.net
contact:Dr. Turaki Bello ( Director General)
private:dr_turabelo@yahoo.ca
 
I have attached my pics to you while in my sickbed for your view and i will be glad if you can also send me your pics and all your contact informations as well, please contact the Bank  and make sure you submit your account informations for the transfer to your acount, please make sure that this fund is used in a Godly way as i stated previously because i do not want this fund to be missused in an ungodly way,
 
Make sure you take 20% of the total money for your help in this matter and use the rest of the fund for the lessprivilaged ones as i stated in my previous email, please try and let me know your discussion with the Bank during their Banking working hours,
 
Please do not forget to put my condition of health in your prayers.
 
May God bless you my dear,
 
Always be prayerful and know that Jesus christ died for our sins,
 
MissGrace.

messages.body:
.
Dear Miss Grace,  (8 Jan  07)
 
I'm sorry that it has been some time since I last wrote to you but things have been very busy here.
 
Firstly, nearly the whole of the UK closed for the Christmas period and two weeks of festivities commenced., As you are a Christian yourself, you will appreciate this, and realise that nothing could come before it.  We had many special services at the Church of the Bush including the Preparing of the Way (a ritual parting of the hair) and the Fine-Toothed Combing.  I also had to prepare and deliver my yearly Sermon on the Mons, if I may say so, to a climactic response from my congregation.
 
Then came the "Week of the Sales".  This is possibly not an observance in some parts of the globe, but in the  UK it is part of the celebrations of Christmas to give all shop keeper's money that you can't afford to give in return for things that you don't really need.  However, I did manage to pick up several grooming aids that I did not know existed from a lady called Anne Summers, and I'm sure our services at the Church of the Bush will be all the livelier.
 
I must say that you are looking very well in your photograph, it is heartening to see that you are bearing your illness with good fortitude.  Good show dear lady. 
 
I see from your previous mail that you've asked me to contact a bank.  I'm not too keen on this as I don't have much to do with banks, they being the dens of shavers, userers and the general ungodly. For is it not written in Proverbs 22.7 "The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender"?  Still, needs must I suppose, I shall write to them shortly and see what needs to be done to get the fortune from their evil, hairless clutches.
 
 
Yours
 
Alex Wale
messages.raw:
[I couldn't be bothered with all this over Christmas, hence the big delay.]

ALEX WALE

. Dear Miss Grace, (8 Jan 07)

I'm sorry that it has been some time since I last wrote to you but things have been very busy here.

Firstly, nearly the whole of the UK closed for the Christmas period and two weeks of festivities commenced., As you are a Christian yourself, you will appreciate this, and realise that nothing could come before it. We had many special services at the Church of the Bush including the Preparing of the Way (a ritual parting of the hair) and the Fine-Toothed Combing. I also had to prepare and deliver my yearly Sermon on the Mons, if I may say so, to a climactic response from my congregation.

Then came the "Week of the Sales". This is possibly not an observance in some parts of the globe, but in the UK it is part of the celebrations of Christmas to give all shop keeper's money that you can't afford to give in return for things that you don't really need. However, I did manage to pick up several grooming aids that I did not know existed from a lady called Anne Summers, and I'm sure our services at the Church of the Bush will be all the livelier.

I must say that you are looking very well in your photograph, it is heartening to see that you are bearing your illness with good fortitude. Good show dear lady.

I see from your previous mail that you've asked me to contact a bank. I'm not too keen on this as I don't have much to do with banks, they being the dens of shavers, userers and the general ungodly. For is it not written in Proverbs 22.7 "The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender"? Still, needs must I suppose, I shall write to them shortly and see what needs to be done to get the fortune from their evil, hairless clutches.

Yours

Alex Wale

[I don't know if the USA has Anne Summers shops, they are a sort of "respectable" sex shop on UK high streets.
So I write to the bank, a Dr Turaki Bello, who becomes, Dr Turaki later on.]

Dear Barrister Rob,  (Jan 16)
 
I'm sorry I haven't replied sooner, I've been in bed with the flu.
 
I see from your last email that you need me to send you some money by some strange stagecoach company?
 
I have a much better idea, why don't you take the amount that you need out of the fund and then just send me the remainder?
 
By the way, you seem to have the 'caps lock' stuck on your keyboard.  Please take it off, writing in capitals is the work of complete idiots and not the sort of thing one would expect from a law firm.
 
Yours
 
Alex Wale

messages.body:
Dear Barrister Rob,  (17 Jan)
 
You are very much mistaken sir, I wasn't 'indirectly' insulting you at all.  However, I am glad to see you have managed to find the caps lock key, "Reperio vestriarse per utriusque manuum" as you legal bods say.
 
It is good news to see that you have managed to arrange for the funds transfer documents payment fee to be taken out of the bulk of the money deposited at the bank, and that you are now just waiting to receive it from them.  That was very quick work and I applaud you.  Be sure that I will mention you to Miss Grace.
 
Yours  Alex Wale

messages.body:
Dear Barrister Rob,  (19 Jan)
 
Oh Dear, that is a shame.
 
Never mind, we'll just have to sort out the fee some other way.
 
I don't know if Miss Grace mentioned this, but I'm a ley-preacher in "The Church of the Bush". Apart from the obvious connotations such as allowing the Bush to flourish naturally and the eternal damnation of all shavers, we as a Church are supposed to circumspect in who we deal with. 
 
Therefore, I am required by my calling and also my congregation to ask before I can do any further business with you if you are an unshaven, God fearing, Christian.
 
Yours
 
Alex Wale

My Dear Alex Wale,  (27 Jan)
 
May God bless you for writing, 
 
I have been in tietar for some days now but today i have a chance to tell the young lady to write you, the Bank has contacted me and also the lawyer of the Bank regarding the deocuments of my funds transfer to your nominated account, 
 
The lawyer said it will cost some money to obtain the document, you know that my late husband deposited this funds in the Bank suspence account and it can not be withdrawed over here until it is transfered outside the country where we can have access to the funds that was why i used you for this work, 
 
I have send the hospital messanger to to go the Bank and pay them sum of$450 as commitiment fees for the document which is the only cash i have at hand here so contact the Bank lawyer and pay him the balance of the total sum so that he can obtain the documents to enble the Bank transfer the funds to your account today or first thing on monday morning, 
 
make sure you follow the Bank instructions as you know that i finds it very difficult to write you but if you want to drop message to me please call the doctor on 0022506778479 and drop a message he will reach me on the sick bed, 
 
May God bless you and your family,
 
Sister Grace Emos.

You haven't answered my query regards shaving, please do so at once, this is important.
 
In the meantime, I would like to arrange a loan from your bank.  It is only a small sum, just $950 to pay the lawyer chappie.  As you will know, we have $4,000,000 in an account in your bank and this can act as security on the loan.
 
If you will send me the necessary documents for this loan, we can get this under way.
 
Thanks
 
Alex Wale

messages.body:
Dear Dr Turaki, (Jan 31)
 
I know that the money is held in a suspended account, I've got that bit, and I realise that I can't use it.  However, you are the DIRECTOR of an International Bank which means that you must have the power to make certain decisions regarding money.  So what I'm asking you to do is to arrange a small loan.
 
Now, you know that I have a 20% share of $4,000,000 dollars in a suspended account.This money will be mine as soon as the paperwork is signed, you know that to be a fact too.  So you have no choice but to conclude that I am a safe bet for a loan of $950.  You will even be handling the transfer of the $4,000,000 when it leaves your bank, and it can be a condition of the loan that the repayment is deducted at source at that time with interest.
 
Loans are what banks do, it shouldn't be too difficult for the Director of such an establishment to sort out.  I'll expect the loan agreement forms with your next email.
 
 
By the way, we still haven't resolved the shaving issue.
 
Yours
 
Alex Wale

messages.body:
Dear Barrister Rob,
 
I'm sorry for the delay in getting the fees to you; I'm being held up by that fool at the bank. 
 
The man is supposed to be the "director" of the bank, but between you and me I think all he directs is the making of the tea.  He seems to have no control over any day to day running of an international banking institution, after all, you'd think that the director would have enough authority to organise a piddling little loan wouldn't you?
 
I'll get back to you as soon as I have organised some money.
 
By the way, you didn't answer my question regarding the shaving.
 
Yours
 
Alex Wale

Yours  Alex Wale

messages.body:
Dear Miss Grace,  (7 Feb)
 
I'm sorry to have to bother you with the details, but the problem with the bank stemmed form the director there.  I asked him to arrange a small loan to cover the expense of the legal documents.  This is something that was very easy and in the UK it would have be sorted by the man on the counter.  However, this so-called director, the man who is in charge of the bank no less, was unable to sort it out!  
 
The man is a useless idiot, I wouldn't trust him to put butter on bread let alone direct a financial institution.  I've written to his superiors to complain. I suspect he is a shaver.
 
In the meantime, I hope you bearing up dear lady.  I must point out, by the way, that you are excused in the issue of shaving, as the Church of the Bush recognises that it is sometimes a necessity for medical reasons.
 
May heaven bless your mirkin.
 
 Alex Wale

messages.body:
Dear Barrister Rob, (14 Feb)
 
I'm sorry this has taken so long, I was struck down by the deadly MIG111 bird flu virus over the weekend, but as you can see I've managed to make a full recovery.  My congregation prayed for me almost religiously, and held a full consummation in my honour.
 
Today I went to the bank to see about sending you the money you need.  The man behind the counter, Mr Norden, was very dubious when I told him that I wanted to send money to the Ivory Coast.  He used some very unprofessional language to describe Abidjan and gave me a leaflet entitled "419 and You", which was all about people in Africa sending out blanket emails and soliciting money from the unwary.  I was shocked.  I'm sure you will agree with me that these people will go straight to Hell and the sooner the better.
 
Anyway, Dennis (Mr. Norden)  said that due to the problems they've had in the past that he wasn't able to use Western Union to send any money to that part of the world (along with several others in a list he showed me).  However, I could send the money by Guaranteed International Money Provision Service or GIMPS which is what I've done.   Apparently, the GIMPS form can be cashed in any bank that bears the VISA sign or carries out VISA transactions and is much safer than Western Union.
 
Yours
 
Alex Wale

[With the above went the GIMPS* form. This was invented by Gilbert Murray, which is why my bank is always Murray's Mint. Murray Mints are an old fashioned UK sweet (candy), they used to be advertised on the TV by Dennis Norden.]

[*popular means of imaginary money transfer - see www.scambuster419.co.uk]

messages.body:
Dear Miss Grace,  (15 Feb)
 
You will be delighted to know that I have sent the money to the barrister, and it is now just a matter of him affecting the transfer; then all that money will be mine for me to carry on with God's work in the Church of the Bush.v
 
I must tell you what I learned when I went to the bank to make the transfer. Apparently, there are some very unscrupulous people in your part of the world who like to play on the gullibility of the naive by asking them for money over the internet. These people are called 419 scammers.  I was lucky to have found someone genuine like you insted of these crooks.  I'm sure that you will join with me in praying for the eternal damnation of these scammers.......... 

Dear Lord,
May their privates all be shaven and their testicles skewered by hot skewery things. 
May the devil himself stoke up the fires and shove his fiery pitchfork up their collective bottoms. 
PS Lord, save something special for that fool at the bank, who is both a liar and an idiot.
Amen

 
Anyway, on to lighter matters, how the cancer progressing?
 
Yours
 
Alex

messages.body:
Dear Miss Grace,  (23 Feb)
 
I haven't heard from you for over a week, please tell me that you haven't popped your clogs!
 
Your last email inspired me to write a new hymn for the church, see what you think.

Working in God's vineyard, digging up the grapes.
Writing on the internet, playing silly japes.
Confusing all the scammers, of the four one nine.
Send them off a GIMPS form, waste a bit more time.
 
You said that you were Miss Grace, but I know you are not.
you are in fact a disgrace, you really should be shot.
You believed my mirkins and the Church of Bush
If you just believed in working you could achieve so much.
 
But no you are a conman and this time you've been done,
you didn't get a penny through Western Union.
You really are too stupid, there's naught inside your head,
Have you ever thought of, tending goats instead?
 
Alex
